newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Ill baby forces BA plane to land in Cyprus.
newsitem.headline: Ill baby forces BA plane to land in Cyprus.

text.p: A British Airways Boeing 777 bound for London from Saudi Arabia made an emergency landing in Cyprus on Tuesday when a baby was taken ill, an airline spokesman said.
Zahira Almirtaha, aged eight months, was travelling with her Iraqi parents when she developed a fever and started vomiting.
One of the airline's Arabic-speaking stewards accompanied the baby and her parents from Larnaca Airport to the general hospital where doctors had been alerted.
The BA plane, which landed in Cyprus at 4.00 a.m. (0100 GMT), later left for London.
"She is fine now. It was probably from the trip or a virus," a doctor at the government hospital in the coastal town of Larnaca told Reuters.
